posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I come to you this time with the guy that kicked Bigby's butt, and made him think about the legendary hands. Joke aside, this character can pack a punch! I decided to eat up the XP penalty and be a halfling just because there is really no better race, as it gives +2 to dex, +1 AB and AC and bonuses to Hide and Move silently, while it still makes little difference how low his STR is, because he'll be throwing 2d6 (edited with the correct info thanks to Empyre65) fists at ya, backed up by the mightiness of Clerical buffs. All sorts of immunities, Empty Body, KD / IKD, Stunning Fists, lvl 27 Epic Dodge and HiPS. His major weakness is dispellability, but he'll run like hell and rebuff right away! No GMW, no Darkfire, but potent fists and a very high AB will make this guy a serious threat to anyone!

Alignment: Any Lawful

Playable 2-20* PvM, untested PvP (as always)

* To make it playable from 1, start with Cleric and lose some skill points or play the 1st level in a party and pretty much watch or snipe. From lvl 2-3, use summons.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:Hail, ECBers!

I come to you this time with the guy that kicked Bigby's butt, and made him think about the legendary hands.
Then why not go elf and get an extra +4 size bonus against grapple checks? I don't see much for halfling apart from +1AC for reisisting Bigby, and the Bigby's that don't make grapple checks do negligible damage given the 20DR of Monk 20. In fact Monk 20 gives full protection from Evard's (paralysis and damage) so you don't need a small race particularly. For 3.5 average extra damage it might be worth it to take elf.

Nope, mate, you didn't get my point there. The joke was that this dude punched the crap out of Bigby and made him obsessed with hands, which would be what led him to devise the spells. Just a joke, not looking to be immune or more resistant to anything.

Anyway, as it turns out that my IE hid the info from me and I mistakenly assumed that I'd have the same damage, I went for Halfling for small stature and stealth skills and saves boni, but with Human I'd get another feat, 1d20 damage on my fists and another 40 skill points, so I'd be inclined to go Human, not Elf, if anything, and delaying ED for 3 levels, which would allow me to get my Cleric buffs capped much earlier if I were willing to relinquish some Spellcraft (which I am). I'll rework the build to Human and post it below ASAP.
